intro: Cleistanthus pseudopallidus, commonly known as the slender cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
